meanings.definition: To provide with new equipment or clothing.
meanings.sent1: I will reoutfit my bike with a shiny new bell.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reoutfit her wardrobe for the upcoming season.
meanings.sent3: The superhero needed to reoutfit his costume after it got torn in battle.
meanings.sent4: The explorer had to reoutfit his backpack for the challenging journey ahead.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to reoutfit the kitchen with the latest gadgets to improve efficiency.

meanings.sent1: After the storm, they had to reoutfit the emergency shelter with supplies.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to reoutfit their camping gear before the next trip.
meanings.sent3: The students had to reoutfit their science project with new materials.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic had to reoutfit his toolbox with additional tools.
meanings.sent5: The office manager had to reoutfit the stationery cabinet with fresh supplies.

meanings.sent1: The actor needed to reoutfit in a different costume for the next scene.
meanings.sent2: They had to reoutfit the room for the new guests arriving.
meanings.sent3: The team had to reoutfit their uniforms for the championship game.
meanings.sent4: The hiker had to reoutfit his backpack for the longer trail.
meanings.sent5: The decorator had to reoutfit the living room for the upcoming party.
